newsitem.title: USA: Vimpel prices secondary offering at $30.
newsitem.headline: Vimpel prices secondary offering at $30.

text.p: American Depositary Shares of Russian cellular telecommunications company Vimpel-Communications were priced at $30 each for a secondary offering, according to lead underwriter Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette.
DLJ said about 3.5 million shares were sold, making the deal worth roughly $100 million.

The shares were sold by FGI Wireless Ltd, a company founded in 1993 as an investment vehicle through which non-Russian venture capitalists and institutions could invest in Vimpel. The company's sole material asset had been its holdings of Vimpel common stock.
Each American Depositary Share represents 3/4 of a Vimpel share. Vimpel closed at 31-5/8 on Thursday on the New York Stock Exchange.
